properties.Name: CarrierRouteCustomerTariffSchedule
properties.Description: The tariff by which the Carrier charges for transfer of goods by the customer with whom they have established a special tariff based on that carrier route.

Columns.Name: CarrierId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Carrier.

Columns.Name: CarrierRouteId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Carrier Route.

Columns.Name: CustomerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer.

Columns.Name: PackingTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Packing Type.

Columns.Name: ShipmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Method.

Columns.Name: ShipmentTermId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Term.

Columns.Name: CargoTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Cargo Type.

Columns.Name: InsuranceOptionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Option.

Columns.Name: MinimumUnitsOfMeasure
Columns.Description: The minimum weight for which the tariff is defined.

Columns.Name: MaximumUnitsOfMeasure
Columns.Description: The maximum weight for which the tariff is defined.

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: ShipmentServiceTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Service Type.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartTimestamp
Columns.Description: The period start timestamp associated with the information.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndTimestamp
Columns.Description: The period end timestamp associated with the information.

Columns.Name: PerUnitOfMeasureShippingChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The per unit shipping charge under the associated parameters.

Columns.Name: MinimumShipmentChargeAmount
Columns.Description: Minimum weight = 0 and max weight = 1000 then your per unit is 5$/kilo, then you need a min. shipping charge of $200.

Columns.Name: ContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract.
